US Open-Source AI Governance

The document discusses the governance of open-source artificial intelligence (AI) and its implications on geopolitical considerations and competition with China. It highlights the need for a balanced approach to ensure safer AI development and mitigation of catastrophic risks. The authors, Claudia Wilson and Emmie Hine from the Center for AI Policy and Yale Digital Ethics Center, respectively, aim to provide policy proposals and advocacy to address these concerns.
